Crime_Name: Refugee Claim and Pre-Removal Risk Assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer erred in not holding an oral hearing or ignoring documentary evidence
Evidence_Assessment: PRRA officer considered new evidence about relatives' experiences with Sunni extremists but did not assess it fully
Credibility_Factor: Credibility was central to the decision; new evidence related to persecution due to religious belief
Legal_Rule: Oral hearing required if credibility is central and new evidence materially affects outcome
Procedural_Issue: Failure to hold oral hearing, adequacy of documentary evidence consideration
Outcome_on_Merits: No reviewable error found; state protection deemed adequate
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No procedural unfairness established despite lack of oral hearing
Key_Evidence_Considered: New evidence regarding relatives' experiences with Sunni extremists
Applicant_Challenge: PRRA decision analysis of credibility and documentary evidence
Remedy_Sought: Overturn PRRA decision, obtain refugee status
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative decision followed by judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Refugee claim and PRRA application rejected
Governing_Rule: Regulation 167 requires oral hearing when credibility is at issue and new evidence could affect outcome
